message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper is about natural language generation (NLG) and the evaluation of NLG systems using automatic metrics. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on the intersection of computer science and linguistics. The paper also discusses the use of machine learning techniques in NLG evaluation, which makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper provides guidelines for conducting validation studies, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of neural networks in NLG, which is relevant to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper discusses the WMT'17 metrics shared task, which is related to cs.SD (Software Engineering).
